location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 93 to Samuel Manesty, in Charge of the Honourable East India Company at Bussora [Basra], from Edward Galley at Bushire

mods.abstract: Letter reports the arrival (and subsequent departure, to Bengal and Bomabay respectively) of the Elizaand the Scorpion. The return of the two Bussora vessels (by the Sheikh of Congoon [KangƒÅn]) and the receipt of a letter of thanks from him is recorded. Details regarding the loss of a Bussora [Basra] vessel near Genowa [Bandar-e Ganaveh] and the robbing and wounding of Indian servants that were on board are also given. Woollen sales are discussed. An additonal note states that bad weather delayed the departure of the BombayGrab and two released vessels.Shipped by the Bombay Grab.
